definitions.text: lengthen or extend in duration or space
examples: We sustained the diplomatic negotiations as long as possible
prolong the treatment of the patient
She suffered a fracture in the accident
He had an insulin shock after eating three candy bars
She got a bruise on her leg
He got his arm broken in the scuffle
We sustained ourselves on bread and water
This kind of food is not nourishing for young children
The money will sustain our good cause
There's little to earn and many to keep

definitions.text: be the physical support of; carry the weight of
examples: The beam holds up the roof
He supported me with one hand while I balanced on the beam

definitions.text: establish or strengthen as with new evidence or facts
